image.altText: A man with cap and white beard at a racing stables leans on a fence.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's leading greyhound trainer wins his appeal against a lifetime ban, with an appeals board ruling it cannot be ruled out that a person "motivated" by "strongly held" beliefs planted a marsupial tail in order to discredit him.

title.children: Activists could have planted animal tail, board rules, as greyhound trainer's lifetime ban quashed

image.altText: Traffic backed up on a highway.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government promised in 2018 to build a fifth lane on Hobart's Southern Outlet. Newly-released documents show there's been a cost blow-out "well in excess" of the $51 million budgeted for the project.

title.children: Call for Hobart's Southern Outlet project to be scrapped due to cost blowout and 'significant' traffic delays

image.altText: Man in suit walking with black umbrella in Melbourne trees in the background

props.synopsis: Large parts of Australia are under a severe storm risk on Wednesday with likely severe storms in southern NSW and north-east Victoria.

title.children: Showers and storms forecast for Tasmania as summer soaking hits Australia's east coast

image.altText: A map showing the tropical low off the coast.

props.synopsis: The chance of a tropical cyclone crossing the Queensland coast next week is "significant" and a "severe impact is possible", according to the latest update from the Bureau of Meteorology.

title.children: BOM warns 'severe impact possible' if second tropical cyclone crosses the Queensland coast

image.altText: Josef Fritzl stands amid security guards

props.synopsis: A lawyers for the 88-year-old, currently serving a life sentence, say he can no longer walk unassisted and no longer poses any danger.

title.children: For 24 years, Josef Fritzl kept his daughter imprisoned in a secret cellar. Now his lawyer says he should be released

image.altText: Storm Hunter and Alex de Minaur pump their fists at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Australian number one Alex de Minaur takes out Italian Matteo Arnaldi in straight sets, with veteran Storm Hunter joining him in the third round after an unconventional three-set win. Follow live.

title.children: Aussie qualifier Storm Hunter joins Alex de Minaur in Australian Open third round

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Live score: Chris O'Connell is the next Australian on deck
Storm Hunter makes it through to the third round!
Alex de Minaur is into the third round of the Australian Open

image.altText: A red and white plane with damaged wing photo taken from inside another plane.

props.synopsis: The final moments of a fatal plane crash that killed two people in Melbourne's Port Phillip Bay last year have been revealed in a preliminary ATSB report into the incident.

title.children: Two light aircraft clipped wings before one plunged into Melbourne's Port Phillip Bay killing two, report says

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Roofing material and debris lays on a living room floor with a gaping hole in the roof.

props.synopsis: Gold Coast father Andrew Price has developed shingles and is unable to sleep as he struggles to cope with the stress of the natural disaster.

title.children: Family still living in home without roof three weeks after Christmas storms

image.altText: Purple ute travelling on major Tasmanian highway as seen by a dash cam in pursuing car.

props.synopsis: Two women are charged after a Hobart Hurricanes ute was captured on video travelling down a highway with a person in back holding down a box — but the cricket club won't say if the pair are players.

title.children: Women charged after illegal act in cricket club ute exposed on social media

image.altText: A police officer on a boat in Karumba.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged with torture and slavery offences, following a police investigation in a remote part of Far North Queensland.

title.children: Deckhands swam through crocodile infested waters to escape being tortured, Queensland police allege

image.altText: A close-up photo of an old man, looking out into the distance, with clouds behind him

props.synopsis: An Irish Catholic priest played an important — but largely secret — role in the conflict over Northern Ireland.

title.children: This Catholic priest was involved in plots that killed scores of people. He has no remorse

image.altText: Australian Catholic University campus

props.synopsis: The Australian Catholic University reveals it underpaid approximately 1,100 casual staff over a seven-year period.

title.children: ACU reveals $3.6m underpayment of casual staff, denies wage theft

image.altText: Steve Smith plays a shot to the leg side

props.synopsis: Australia takes on a much changed West Indies team in the second Test series of the summer at Adelaide Oval. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Smith's first innings as opener ended by Windies debutant's first ball in Test cricket

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: GOT HIM! SMITH IS OUT TO SHAMAR JOSEPH'S FIRST BALL IN TEST CRICKET!
OUT! Joseph's fine innings ends, WI all out 188

image.altText: The Danish flag flying between the Australian and Tasmanian flags at parliament house in Hobart

props.synopsis: To celebrate Tasmania's own locally born royal, the Danish flag was yesterday flown at parliament house along with the Australian and state flags.The Aboriginal flag was taken down to fit it.

title.children: Row over Danish flag replacing Aboriginal flag above Tasmanian parliament building

image.altText: Stephen Edwards with parents David and Nelda

props.synopsis: Brothers Stephen and Robert Edwards have given evidence in the inquest into their parents' 2016 deaths. The brothers had previously been charged in relation to their mother's death, but the charges were later dropped.

title.children: Elderly woman was not in imminent danger of death when given palliative care drugs, inquest hears

image.altText: A court sketch showing a man in a suit and a woman sketched behind him.

props.synopsis: Writer E Jean Carroll is seeking at least $US10 million in damages in a civil case that will put sexual assault allegations against Donald Trump back in the headlines.

title.children: Donald Trump back in court for second defamation trial after Iowa victory

image.altText: Three men and a woman from band No Doubt stand back to back before a blue wall. Gwen Stefani points fingers at camera.

props.synopsis: No Doubt, led by Gwen Stefani, were one of the biggest rock acts of the 90s and 2000s. The band's reformation was a surprise announcement as part of the Coachella 2024 line-up.

title.children: Gwen Stefani reunites with No Doubt for first shows in almost a decade at Coachella

image.altText: a man in a business suit walks outside a court building

props.synopsis: The 28-year-old is accused of causing a horrific road crash in South Australia's Mid North in October that claimed the lives of three people, including one who died in hospital a week after the collision.

title.children: Italian tourist faces court over campervan crash that claimed lives of elderly couple and daughter

image.altText: A man stands at a sink washing dishes.

props.synopsis: Liaqat Ali Zahidi will remain in custody after being found not guilty of attempting to murder a man at a East Perth hostel, with the Supreme Court hearing the 30-year-old was of unsound mind at the time.

title.children: Man behind unprovoked backpacker knife attack found not guilty of attempted murder on insanity grounds

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a face mask covers his face as he exits court behind his lawyer.

props.synopsis: It will be alleged the 39-year-old sent messages purporting to be from companies, including Australia Post and Linkt.

title.children: Man accused of sending 17 million scam texts in a week also allegedly had passport and licence details

image.altText: A close up of a pile of SIM cards lying on a table, overlapping and showing their metal contacts

props.synopsis: Authorities say nine customers had their SIM cards illegally swapped without them knowing, and five of them together lost more than $160,000.

title.children: Telco fined $260k after SIM-swapping scam leads customers to lose thousands

image.altText: A surveillance camera is silhouetted behind a Chinese national flag in Beijing.

props.synopsis: Australian shares close lower as Chinese GDP data confirm an economic slowdown. Look back on our markets blog to see how Wednesday's events unfolded.

title.children: China's economy has 'lost momentum', gold miners drag ASX lower — as it happened

image.altText: Aboriginal elder signing document

props.synopsis: Ted Carlton has long been a prominent Indigenous advocate in the Kununurra community. Now he is accused of carnal knowledge with a child under 16 when he was a teenager in the 1970s.

title.children: Kimberley elder steps down from native title group after historical carnal knowledge allegations

image.altText: A woman sitting in the dark.

props.synopsis: About a third of the alleged killers had a domestic violence order against them — or had contact with police in the 12 months before the deaths.

title.children: Queensland domestic violence homicide rate rises 50 pc in one year

image.altText: Houthi fighters and tribesmen stand on and around a ute holding up guns.

props.synopsis: The US hit Houthi anti-ship ballistic missiles in its latest strikes against the group's targets in Yemen, after the rebels continued attacks in global shipping lanes.

title.children: US hits more Houthi targets in Yemen as rebels strike Greek cargo ship in Red Sea

image.altText: Close up of Rex Heuerman next to his lawyer in court.

props.synopsis: A New York architect charged in a string of slayings known as the Gilgo Beach killings has been accused of the death of a fourth woman.

title.children: Suspect in Long Island's Gilgo Beach serial killings is charged with the death of fourth woman

image.altText: A man in a dark hoodie walks away from a building beneath a pale sky.

props.synopsis: Brett Andrew Button has been formally charged with manslaughter after he was accused of dangerous driving leading to a crash that killed 10 wedding guests in the NSW Hunter Valley.

title.children: Hunter Valley bus driver formally charged with 10 counts of manslaughter over wedding crash

image.altText: image of woman with curly hair in green shirt smiling

props.synopsis: The comedian has a 97-per cent chance of contracting cancer, but taking a genetic test to shed more light on the risk could ruin her chances to obtain life insurance.

title.children: Choosing between life insurance or taking a genetic test is no laugh for comedian Michelle Brasier

image.altText: Man covers his face as he walks out of police car escorted by police officer

props.synopsis: The men have faced court over the alleged murder of Rockhampton local Anuisha Bone, who was fatally shot in November.

title.children: Police charge two men with murder months after fatal shooting in Rockhampton

image.altText: An RAC worker looking into a yellow roadside assistance van

props.synopsis: RAC's first-ever electric roadside assistance van has arrived on Perth streets, ready to rescue electric vehicle drivers in need.

title.children: Meet the rescue van scouring the streets to help stranded EV drivers who have run out of juice

image.altText: Mirra Andreeva pumps her right fist after winning a point at the 2024 Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Teenager Mirra Andreeva puts the Australian Open on notice with a convincing defeat of world number six Ons Jabeur, who could only win two games against her younger opponent.

title.children: Russian 16yo thrashes Wimbledon finalist in massive Australian Open shock

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks in front of a microphone

props.synopsis: Some British Postal Service workers were jailed, others ostracised and some took their lives over theft convictions prompted by faulty software.

title.children: 900 British postal workers were wrongly convicted due to an IT error. Now, those responsible are apologising

image.altText: Close up of Kim Jong Un speaking at a podium

props.synopsis: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un says his country will no longer pursue reconciliation with South Korea, calling for rewriting the North’s constitution to eliminate the idea of shared statehood between the war-divided countries, according to state media.

title.children: North Korea will no longer pursue reconciliation with South because of hostility, Kim Jong Un says

image.altText: A split image of two smiling young women.

props.synopsis: A cold case investigation has resulted in a 62-year-old man being charged over the unrelated alleged abduction of a teenage girl in the Lake Macquarie region of New South Wales in the 1980s.

title.children: Cold case investigation into suspected murder of three teenagers leads to abduction charges

image.altText: Bobi the dog sitting on the grass.

props.synopsis: Bobi's Guinness World Records title as oldest dog ever is under review after veterinarians raise doubts.

title.children: Guinness World Records reviews evidence related to 'world's oldest dog' title
